content:
I am working on #18359 - Add "hide warning for 7 days" button in SERVER_UPGRADE_NAG_DEADLINE_DAYS nag feature.

I have added the button in the alert.

This is how it looks now,
Screenshot-2021-05-05-at-10.53.18-PM.png

Can someone guide me about the button design?
Maybe the text would be better as "Dismiss for a week."?
The whitespace looks a bit off -- we should use a consistent number of spaces (1) between sentences.
The link styling is also a little weird?
Yeah that's because I have wrapped the button inside .buttons span.
I think you can potentially grab some styling tricks from the "desktop notifications" panels.js element -- I think it had a dot or something between the links, which might be better here too.

Something like this?

I have removed the full stop because it was looking weird.

Screenshot-2021-05-05-at-11.08.36-PM.png
That seems fine to me; others may have more thoughts but we can always do a quick follow-up tweak to the styling.

Maybe "Dismiss for one week"? Having the time indicated really explicitly feels more like the common pattern for these types of warnings to me, though I don't have examples handy one way or the other.

Yeah, I don't think it super matters; ultimately the "Learn more" link tells them what they need to know in order to disable the notice for everyone; this "Dismiss" button is mainly there so it's not super annoying if you're really busy at the time you see this.
